concept.title: Concepts
concept.shortdesc: Concepts explain and show. Novice readers rely on concepts to gain a fundamental understanding of your product.

section.title: Who and why
section.p: People who are new to your product will be the most likely consumers of concepts. These novices need a foundational understanding of the subject matter and the underlying abstract ideas.

Readers read a concept to try to understand
what things are and what they do, and
how things work together.

example.title: Examples
example.p:
Some examples of concepts include:
A lengthy definition with an example
A diagram that illustrates infrastructure or architecture
A description of components of a product
An explanation of how components work together

section.title: Keeping it conceptual
section.p: It is easy to put more into a concept than you should. As soon as you start adding how to information into a concept, such as tips or what buttons to select, you know you've strayed from the purpose of a concept. Anything that tells the reader how to do something belongs in a task instead.
